did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Materials of Professor Chai Feldblum relating to the effort by the Campaign for Military Service to assist President Clinton in his stated desire to lift the ban on gay service members. These materials include all documents used to lobby Congress and raise public awareness in 1993, as well as internal documents detailing efforts to propose alternatives to the Don't Ask Don't Tell policy. Also, files regarding the Employment Non-Discrimination Act (ENDA).

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Professor Chai Feldblum was the Legal Director for the Campaign for Military Service (CMS).

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Materials of Professor Chai Feldblum relating to the effort by the Campaign for Military Service to assist President Clinton in his stated desire to lift the ban on gay service members. These materials include all documents used to lobby Congress and raise public awareness in 1993, as well as internal documents detailing efforts to propose alternatives to the Don't Ask Don't Tell policy.
Also, files regarding the Employment Non-Discrimination Act (ENDA).

p.emph: One folder of correspondence has been RESTRICTED until 2019. This folder is temporarily stored in the Accession File.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Chai Feldbllum papers, #7697. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

arrangement.head: COLLECTION ARRANGEMENT
arrangement.p: Where possible, original folder headings have been retained. Folders labeled "Miscellaneous" contain information papers, comments by Navy officers, retired officials and veterans, various background papers, and other ban-related miscellany.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p:
Series II. Congressional Record Project
Boxes 2-3

Series IV. CMS Organizational Materials
Box 15

Series VI. Employment Non-Discrimination Act (ENDA)
Boxes 17-20
